197302150001,1973,2,15,,0,,217,United States,1,North America,New York,New York City,40.697132,-73.931351,1,0,"Manhattan;" Alexander's Department Store
iday: 02/16/1973: Suspected members of  the Armed Revolutionary Independence Movement (MIRA) placed an incendiary device in a raincoat display in the mezzanine of Alexander's Department store in New York City in the United States.  The device was removed by two members of the NYC Police bomb squad before the device was set off.   There was no damage to the store or to merchandise.
nhostkidus: ""Metropolitan Briefs: Police Check on Incendiary Device
ransompaidus: """"Political Violence and Terrorism in Modern America: A Chronology
column1235: 2/27/1973: Around two hundred members of the American Indian Movement took over and occupied the town of Wounded Knee
column1238: taking eleven hostages.  The release of the hostages was negotiated after two days";" however
column1239: only one of them decided to leave the occupied town.  The siege lasted seventy-one days.  Two AIM members were shot and killed and at least one was wounded.  A member of the US Marshalls was wounded as well.   The occupation would end peacefully on May 9 with the disarmament of AIM.""
column1260: Town of Wounded Knee South Dakota
column1285: The American Indian movement hoped to raise worldwide awareness of the plight of Native Americans in the United States.  Specifically
column1286: AIM hoped to 1) Force the federal government to investigate corruption on Indian reservations.  2) Force a senate investigation of broken treaties between the United States government and Native Americans.  3) Force the dismissal of Dick Wilson
column1287: the tribal chair of the Pine Ridge Reservation.""
column1320: armed with firearms and molotov cocktails
column1349: the days were normally calm while there were shoot-outs between the American Indian Movement and United States government officials at night.  AIM members Frank Clearwater and Lawrence Lamonte were shot and killed.  US Marshal Lloyd Grimm was shot and seriously wounded.""
column1362: and Political Violence in the United States: January 1965 to March 1976
column1363: " National Advisory Committee on Criminal Justice Standards and Goals: Report of the Task Force on Disorders and Terrorism
column2477: 03/04/1973: An explosive device planted in the trunk of a green Plymouth rental car was intended to detonate at noon outside an El Al Airlines terminal warehouse at John F. Kennedy International Airport in New York City
column2479: United States. This was one of three unsuccessful coordinated attacks timed to coincide with Israeli Prime Minister Golda Meir's visit to the United States. The other two involved similar devices in cars parked near Israeli banks on Fifth Avenue. The explosives failed to detonate due to faulty circuitry and were discovered and defused on March 7. On March 15
column2480: officials issued an arrest warrant for 27-year-old Iraqi citizen Khalid Dahham Al-Jawary
column2481: identified as a Black September operative. Al-Jawary was arrested in January 1991
column2482: convicted and sentenced to 30 years in prison in 1993
column2483: and released and deported from the United States in 2009.""
column2562: Three 5-gallon containers of gasoline"; three 20-lb bottles of propane; two bags of plastic explosives;" all attached to blasting caps and timing devices
column2591: ""Bomb is Defused at El Al Facility: Explosives also Found in Car Near Israeli Bank
column2595: Martin. """"Iraqi Linked to Black September is Sought in Bomb-Planting Here

eventid: 197303040006,1973,3,4,,0,,217,United States,1,North America,New York,New York City,40.697132,-73.931351,1,0,Fifth Ave and 47th St,"03/04/1973: An explosive device planted in the trunk of rental car was intended to detonate at noon outside an Israeli bank in New York City, New York, United States. This was one of three unsuccessful coordinated attacks timed to coincide with Israeli Prime Minister Golda Meir's visit to the United States. The other two involved similar devices in cars parked near an El Al Airlines warehouse at John F. Kennedy International Airport, and at a second Israeli bank on Fifth Avenue. The devices failed to detonate due to faulty circuitry. They were discovered and defused on March 7, after the explosive-laden cars had been towed to an impound lot. On March 15, officials issued an arrest warrant for 27-year-old Iraqi citizen Khalid Dahham Al-Jawary, identified as a Black September operative. Al-Jawary was arrested in January 1991, convicted and sentenced to 30 years in prison in 1993, and released and deported from the United States in 2009.",1,1,1,0,,,1,0,0,3,Bombing/Explosion,,,,,1,Business,3,Bank/Commerce,First Israel Bank and Trust Company of New York,Bank Building,97,Israel,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,Black September,,,,,,,0,,,0,1,1,0,,,,,,,,,,6,Explosives,15,Vehicle,,,,,,,,,,,,,,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,,,,,0,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,"""Bomb is Defused at El Al Facility: Explosives also Found in Car Near Israeli Bank,"" March 8, 1973.","Tolchin, Martin. ""Iraqi Linked to Black September is Sought in Bomb-Planting Here,"" The New York Times, March 16, 1973.","""Across the Nation,"" The Augusta Chronicle, February 27, 2009.",UMD Miscellaneous,1,1,1,1,"197303040005, 197303040006, 197303040007";;;

197303040007,1973,3,4,,0,,217,United States,1,North America,New York,New York City,40.697132,-73.931351,1,0,511 Fifth Ave,"03/04/1973: An explosive device planted in the trunk of rental car was intended to detonate at noon outside an Israeli bank in New York City, New York, United States. This was one of three unsuccessful coordinated attacks timed to coincide with Israeli Prime Minister Golda Meir's visit to the United States. The other two involved similar devices in cars parked near an El Al Airlines warehouse at John F. Kennedy International Airport, and at a second Israeli bank on Fifth Avenue. The devices failed to detonate due to faulty circuitry. They were discovered and defused on March 7, after the explosive-laden cars had been towed to an impound lot. On March 15, officials issued an arrest warrant for 27-year-old Iraqi citizen Khalid Dahham Al-Jawary, identified as a Black September operative. Al-Jawary was arrested in January 1991, convicted and sentenced to 30 years in prison in 1993, and released and deported from the United States in 2009.",1,1,1,0,,,1,0,0,3,Bombing/Explosion,,,,,1,Business,3,Bank/Commerce,"Israel Discount Bank, Ltd.",Bank Building,97,Israel,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,Black September,,,,,,,0,,,0,1,1,0,,,,,,,,,,6,Explosives,15,Vehicle,,,,,,,,,,,,,Two 5-gallon containers of gasoline with timing devices.,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,,,,,0,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,"""Bomb is Defused at El Al Facility: Explosives also Found in Car Near Israeli Bank,"" March 8, 1973.","Tolchin, Martin. ""Iraqi Linked to Black September is Sought in Bomb-Planting Here,"" The New York Times, March 16, 1973.","""Across the Nation,"" The Augusta Chronicle, February 27, 2009.",UMD Miscellaneous,1,1,1,1,"197303040005, 197303040006, 197303040007";;;

197303120001,1973,3,12,,0,,217,United States,1,North America,Puerto Rico,Rio Piedras,18.386932,-66.061127,1,0,"University of Puerto Rico, suburban campus at Rio Piedras","03/12/1973: A bomb explodes at the social studies building of the University of Puerto Rico, Rio Piedras campus in Puerto Rico, destroying forty offices on the fourth and much of the third floor. There were no casualties.  The perpetrators are unknown;" however
iyear: the campus had been involved in ongoing disputes between university administration and student advocates for Puerto Rico's independence from the U.S.""
natlty2: the campus had been involved in ongoing disputes between university administration and student advocates for Puerto Rico's independence from the U.S.""
